001package imagingbook.lib.image.access;
002
003import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
004import imagingbook.lib.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
005
006/** 
007 * Accessor for vector-valued images with arbitrary depth 
008 * (number of components).
009 *
010 */
011public abstract class VectorAccessor extends ImageAccessor {
012        
013        protected final int depth;
014        protected final ScalarAccessor[] componentAccessors;
015
016        protected VectorAccessor(ImageProcessor ip, int depth, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
017                super(ip, obs, ipm);
018                this.depth = depth;
019                this.componentAccessors = new ScalarAccessor[this.depth];
020                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
021                        componentAccessors[k] = makeComponentAccessor(k);
022                }
023        }
024        
025        /**
026         * To be implemented by all real sublasses of {@link ScalarAccessor}, 
027         * who know how to create an accessor object to their k-th component.
028         * See {@link RgbAccessor#makeComponentAccessor(int)} for an example.
029         * 
030         * @param k the component index
031         * @return the image accessor for the specified component
032         */
033        protected abstract ScalarAccessor makeComponentAccessor(int k);
034        
035        @Override
036        public int getDepth() {
037                return this.depth;
038        }
039        
040        @Override
041        public ScalarAccessor getComponentAccessor(int k) {
042                checkComponentIndex(k);
043                return componentAccessors[k];
044        }
045        
046        @Override
047        public float getVal(int u, int v, int k) {
048                checkComponentIndex(k);
049                return componentAccessors[k].getVal(u, v);
050        }
051        
052        @Override
053        public float getVal(double x, double y, int k) {
054                checkComponentIndex(k);
055                return componentAccessors[k].getVal(x, y);
056        }
057        
058        @Override
059        public void setVal(int u, int v, int k, float val) {
060                checkComponentIndex(k);
061                componentAccessors[k].setVal(u, v, val);
062        }
063        
064        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
065        
066//      @Override
067//      public void setDefaultValue(float val) {
068//              for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
069//                      componentAccessors[k].setDefaultValue(val);
070//              }
071//      }
072        
073//      @Override
074//      public void setDefaultValue(float[] vals) {
075//              if (vals.length != depth) {
076//                      throw new IllegalArgumentException("default values must be of length " + depth);
077//              }
078//              for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
079//                      componentAccessors[k].setDefaultValue(vals[k]);
080//              }
081//      }
082        
083        protected void checkComponentIndex(int k) {
084                if (k < 0 || k >= depth) {
085                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("invalid component index " + k);
086                }
087        }
088
089}
